Name: Great Pyramid of Giza
Characteristic: The only surviving wonder of the ancient world, originally built as a tomb for the Pharaoh Khufu.

Name: Hanging Gardens of Babylon
Location: Babylon, near present-day Hillah, Babil province, Iraq
Characteristic: Said to be an astonishing set of gardens, which showcased the engineering prowess of the ancient Mesopotamians.

Name: Statue of Zeus at Olympia
Characteristic: A monumental statue of the god Zeus, made by the sculptor Phidias. It was one of the tallest statues of the ancient world.

Name: Temple of Artemis at Ephesus
Location: Ephesus (near present-day Selçuk, Izmir Province), Turkey
Characteristic: A grand temple dedicated to the goddess Artemis, rebuilt three times before its eventual destruction.

Name: Mausoleum at Halicarnassus
Characteristic: A tomb built for Mausolus, the Persian satrap of Caria, notable for its architectural beauty and considered the origin of the word 'mausoleum'.

Name: Colossus of Rhodes
Characteristic: A giant statue of the sun god Helios, erected on the island of Rhodes. It was one of the tallest statues of the ancient world.

Name: Lighthouse of Alexandria
Characteristic: A tower built by the Ptolemaic Kingdom on the island of Pharos in Alexandria to serve as a lighthouse, one of the tallest man-made structures of the ancient world.
